citation.title: LMEC Historic Boston Shoreline
citation.shortDescription: Standardized boundaries of historic shoreline; geography covers the City of Boston and parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop; time period covers 1630-present in a series of temporal snapshots
citation.fullDescription: This dataset represents the extents of Boston's historic shoreline. It covers the City of Boston and includes some parts of Cambridge, Somerville, Chelsea and Winthrop. This data is structured as temporal snapshots capturing the shoreline extent at different years. The years included in the dataset are 1635, 1795, 1852, 1880, 1916, 1934, 1950, 1995 and the present day. Different versions of this data have existed in the past, digitally 'hand-drawn' by cartographers creating maps for print publications. The datasets used to create these maps until now haven't been archived in GIS-compatible formats. This LMEC-maintained dataset is a stable, standardized GIS boundary file of historic shoreline extents. The LMEC has standardized and preserved data submitted by cartographers working on the Atlas of Boston History book project.
citation.accessCondition: This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use.

endpoints.title: Boston Historic Shoreline Land Extent GeoJSON
Boston Historic Shoreline Water Extent GeoJSON

temporal.temporalNotes: This data represents the historic state of the Boston shoreline in the year 1995. It was digitally derived in 2019 from born-digital maps published in 1995.

ingredients.notes: This source data, which contained separate files for each year, was consolidated and cleaned up into singular land and water files

maintenance.maintenanceFrequency: This dataset is not frequently updated

processing.steps:
1. Download the original MapWorks Shoreline data 
 2. Write a [Python Script](https://s3.us-east-2.wasabisys.com/public-geospatial/dkircu2ol/processor.py) that combines all the separate years from the MapWorks data into single water and land geoJSONS

publishedWorks.title: All Over the Map: How Boston Made Itself Bigger
publishedWorks.author: Betsy Mason
